name: NSLevelIndicator
desc: A visual representation of a level or quantity, using discrete values.

items.name: class NSLevelIndicatorCell
items.desc: NSLevelIndicatorCell is a subclass of NSActionCell that provides several level indicator display styles including: capacity, ranking and relevancy. The capacity style provides both continuous and discrete modes.

items.name: var tickMarkPosition: NSSlider.TickMarkPosition
items.desc: Determines how the receiver’s tick marks are aligned with it.

items.name: var numberOfTickMarks: Int
items.desc: The number of tick marks associated with the receiver.

items.name: var numberOfMajorTickMarks: Int
items.desc: The number of major tick marks associated with the receiver.

items.name: func tickMarkValue(at: Int) -> Double
items.desc: Returns the receiver’s value represented by the tick mark at the specified index (the minimum-value tick mark has an index of 0).

items.name: func rectOfTickMark(at: Int) -> NSRect
items.desc: Returns the bounding rectangle of the tick mark identified by the specified index (the minimum-value tick mark is at index 0).

items.name: enum NSLevelIndicator.Style
items.desc: Constants that specify a level indicator's appearance.
